definition: whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)

sentences.english: Weeping and wailing should follow, and beatings are borne without complaint.
sentences.chinese: 再跟着下来就是号哭，就算被鞭挞也不埋怨。

sentences.english: The weakness is that it takes its crusading a little far.
sentences.chinese: 而美中不足的是在进行讨伐鞭挞的时候走的有点远了。

sentences.english: Do you fear the force of the wind
sentences.chinese: 你是否害怕狂风的鞭挞？

sentences.english: Their heritage from generation to generation is the belled yoke and the lash.''
sentences.chinese: 它们一代代的命运就是套上枷锁，接受鞭挞。

sentences.english: Captain white scourged his crew without mercy .
sentences.chinese: 船长怀特无情地鞭挞船员。

sentences.english: Flagellation is thought to be helpful in cases of atrophy and emaciation .
sentences.chinese: 鞭挞被认为是在萎缩和消瘦的案件有帮助。

sentences.english: Andit also encourages the dangerous compensation practices that Posner pillories .
sentences.chinese: 而且，它还会鼓励波斯纳所鞭挞的危险的补偿实践。

sentences.english: Identifying scapegoats and inciting others to castigate them.
sentences.chinese: 指定替罪羔羊，煽动其他人鞭挞他们。

sentences.english: The film mercilessly castigates the old society.
sentences.chinese: 影片对旧社会进行了无情的鞭挞。

sentences.english: Captain White scourged his crew without mercy.
sentences.chinese: 船长怀特无情地鞭挞船员。

sentences.english: Swedish thrash metal band 2 Ton Predator.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典鞭挞金属乐队2吨的“捕食者”。

definition: to flog/to lash/to whip/to urge or goad along
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to critique/to voice concerns about/ancient form of acupuncture using sharp stones as needles
to spur on/to urge on/to encourage sb (e.g. to make progress)
to spit on and curse/to revile
